duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform laboratory tests demonstrating understanding of normal ranges due to sex and/or age from neonatal through geriatric population groups.

Perform automated, semi-automated, and manual procedures in the fields of bacteriology, parasitology, hematology, coagulation, serology, chemistry, urinalysis, immunology, and immunohematology according to established procedures and policies.
Report results according to established professional standards, following the interpretation, verification, and validation of procedures.
Work actively and cooperatively with nursing and other hospital staff to ensure timely patient care. Assists with regulatory compliance.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Medical Technology from an accredited college or university and successful score on a national examination for certification approved by the State Board
